intro: Xiquexique gounellei, commonly known as the Guianan starfruit, is a rare and unique plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped fruits that resemble small, colorful lanterns. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a glossy surface that reflects light. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
